Package org.bluezoo.gonzalez

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gonzalez.Parser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.xml.sax.XMLReader
    public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.xml.sax.XMLReader
    Gonzalez streaming XML parser.

    This class provides the public interface to the Gonzalez parser. As a SAX2 XMLReader, it allows it to be used with existing SAX2 frameworks and applications. Internally, it uses a streaming pipeline (tokenizer and syntax parser) to perform the parsing.

    The same Parser instance to be reused for multiple documents by calling reset() between parses.

    The parser supports:

    • Standard SAX2 handlers: ContentHandler, DTDHandler, ErrorHandler
    • SAX2 extension handlers: LexicalHandler
    • Low-level byte buffer API for streaming
    • Automatic charset detection (BOM and XML declaration)
    • Line-end normalization
    • Legacy blocking parsing from InputStream
    • Parser reuse via reset()
    • Standard SAX2 Locator2 interface for reporting

    Streaming usage: 

     Parser parser = new Parser();
 parser.setContentHandler(myContentHandler);
 parser.setSystemId("http://example.com/doc.xml");
 
 // Feed data in chunks
 ByteBuffer buffer = ByteBuffer.wrap(data);
 parser.receive(buffer); // repeat while data is available
 
 // Signal end of document
 parser.close();
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Constructor Detail

      • Parser

        public Parser()
        Creates a new Parser instance. The tokenizer is initialized in PROLOG_BEFORE_DOCTYPE state (post-XMLDecl). The decoder handles XMLDecl parsing before feeding content to the tokenizer.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public void parse​(org.xml.sax.InputSource input)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Parses an XML document from an InputSource.

        This is the standard SAX2 parsing method. It reads data from the InputSource's byte stream in chunks and feeds them to the streaming parser. This method blocks until the entire document has been parsed.

        For non-blocking parsing, use the receive(ByteBuffer) and close() methods instead.

        If the InputSource specifies a public ID, system ID, or encoding, these will be used by the parser. The encoding can be overridden by a BOM or XML declaration in the document itself.

        Specified by:
        parse in interface org.xml.sax.XMLReader
        Parameters:
        input - the InputSource containing the document to parse
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs reading from the stream
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - if a parsing error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input is null

      • parse

        public void parse​(java.lang.String systemId)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Parses an XML document identified by a system ID (URI).

        This method resolves the system ID to an InputSource using the configured EntityResolver, or a default resolver if none is set. The resolved InputSource is then parsed using parse(InputSource).

        The system ID is typically a URL (http:, https:, file:) or a relative path that will be resolved against the current working directory.

        Specified by:
        parse in interface org.xml.sax.XMLReader
        Parameters:
        systemId - the system identifier (URI) of the document to parse
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - if a parsing error occurs or the URI cannot be resolved
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if systemId is null

        public void setErrorHandler​(org.xml.sax.ErrorHandler handler)
        Sets the error handler to receive parsing errors.

        The error handler receives callbacks for warnings, recoverable errors, and fatal errors. If no error handler is set, fatal errors will still throw SAXException.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • setEntityResolver

        public void setEntityResolver​(org.xml.sax.EntityResolver resolver)
        Sets the entity resolver for resolving external entities.

        The entity resolver is called to resolve external entities referenced in the document, including the external DTD subset and external parsed entities. The resolver can provide alternative input sources or redirect resolution to different locations.

        Gonzalez also supports EntityResolver2 for enhanced resolution capabilities.

        Specified by:
        setEntityResolver in interface org.xml.sax.XMLReader
        Parameters:
        resolver - the entity resolver, or null to use the default resolver
        See Also:
        EntityResolver, EntityResolver2

      • getFeature

        public boolean getFeature​(java.lang.String name)
                   throws org.xml.sax.SAXNotRecognizedException,
                          org.xml.sax.SAXNotSupportedException
        Returns the value of a parser feature.

        Gonzalez supports the following SAX2 features:

        Supported SAX2 features
        Feature URIDefaultDescription
        http://xml.org/sax/features/namespaces truePerform namespace processing
        http://xml.org/sax/features/namespace-prefixes falseReport xmlns attributes
        http://xml.org/sax/features/validation falseValidate against DTD
        http://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities trueInclude external general entities
        http://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities trueInclude external parameter entities
        http://xml.org/sax/features/string-interning trueIntern element/attribute names
        http://xml.org/sax/features/is-standalone false(Read-only) Document standalone status
        http://xml.org/sax/features/xml-1.1 true(Read-only) XML 1.1 support
        Specified by:
        getFeature in interface org.xml.sax.XMLReader
        Parameters:
        name - the feature URI
        Returns:
        the current value of the feature (true or false)
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXNotRecognizedException - if the feature is not recognized
        org.xml.sax.SAXNotSupportedException - if the feature cannot be read
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if name is null

      • setFeature

        public void setFeature​(java.lang.String name,
                       boolean value)
                throws org.xml.sax.SAXNotRecognizedException,
                       org.xml.sax.SAXNotSupportedException
        Sets the value of a parser feature.

        See getFeature(String) for the list of supported features. Some features are read-only and cannot be changed.

        Features should be set before parsing begins. Setting features during parsing may have undefined behavior.

        Specified by:
        setFeature in interface org.xml.sax.XMLReader
        Parameters:
        name - the feature URI
        value - the new value for the feature
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXNotRecognizedException - if the feature is not recognized
        org.xml.sax.SAXNotSupportedException - if the feature cannot be set to the specified value (e.g., read-only features)
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if name is null

        Supported properties
        Property URITypeDescription
        http://xml.org/sax/properties/lexical-handler LexicalHandler Handler for lexical events (comments, CDATA, entity boundaries)
        http://www.nongnu.org/gonzalez/properties/dtd-parser DTDParser (Read-only) The DTD parser instance, if DOCTYPE was encountered

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Resets the parser state to allow reuse for parsing another document.

        This method clears all parsing state from the tokenizer and XML parser, allowing the same Parser instance to be reused for multiple documents. Handler references (ContentHandler, DTDHandler, etc.) are preserved.

        Usage: 

         Parser parser = new Parser();
 parser.setContentHandler(handler);

 // Parse first document
 parser.parse(new InputSource(stream1));

 // Reset for reuse
 parser.reset();

 // Parse second document with same handlers
 parser.parse(new InputSource(stream2));

        Note: You should call this method after a parse completes and before starting a new parse. It is not necessary to call reset() before the first parse.

        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - if reset fails

      • setPublicId

        public void setPublicId​(java.lang.String publicId)
        Sets the public identifier for the document.

        The public identifier is used for error reporting and may be used by entity resolvers. This delegates to the external entity decoder which provides location information.

        If parsing via parse(InputSource), the public ID from the InputSource takes precedence over this setting.

        Parameters:
        publicId - the public identifier, or null if not available

      • setSystemId

        public void setSystemId​(java.lang.String systemId)
        Sets the system identifier for the document.

        The system identifier (typically a URL) is used for resolving relative URIs and for error reporting. This delegates to the external entity decoder which provides location information.

        If parsing via parse(InputSource), the system ID from the InputSource takes precedence over this setting.

        Parameters:
        systemId - the system identifier, or null if not available

      • receive

        public void receive​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
             throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Receives raw byte data for parsing.

        This is an advanced API that allows streaming data to the parser in chunks without using an InputStream. The data buffer should be prepared for reading (position set to start of data, limit set to end of data). This delegates directly to the underlying tokenizer.

        Multiple invocations of this method may occur to supply the complete document content. The parser will handle buffer underflow conditions automatically, requesting more data as needed.

        Usage: 

         Parser parser = new Parser();
 parser.setContentHandler(handler);
 parser.setSystemId("http://example.com/doc.xml");

 ByteBuffer data1 = ByteBuffer.wrap(bytes1);
 parser.receive(data1);

 ByteBuffer data2 = ByteBuffer.wrap(bytes2);
 parser.receive(data2);

 parser.close(); // Signal end of document

        Important: You must call close() after the last receive to signal end of document and allow the parser to finish processing.

        Parameters:
        data - a byte buffer ready for reading (position at start, limit at end)
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - if a parsing error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called after close()

      • close

        public void close()
           throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Signals that all data has been received and completes parsing.

        This method must be called after the last receive(java.nio.ByteBuffer) call to signal the end of the document. The parser will process any remaining buffered data and generate final SAX events (such as endDocument). This delegates to the decoder which will flush to the tokenizer.

        After this method is called, you can call reset() to prepare the parser for reuse with another document.

        If there is incomplete data (e.g., an unclosed element), this method will throw a SAXException.

        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - if there is incomplete or invalid data
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called without prior receive(java.nio.ByteBuffer)

      • getPublicId

        public java.lang.String getPublicId()

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Command-line entry point for testing the parser.

        Parses XML files specified as command-line arguments using a default (no-op) content handler. Useful for testing well-formedness of XML documents.

        Usage: java org.bluezoo.gonzalez.Parser file1.xml [file2.xml ...]

        Parameters:
        args - paths to XML files to parse
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if parsing fails
